trigger: TargetCo users are in ParentCo Azure AD tenant, requiring separation to BuyerCo tenant
impact_description: Complex user migration, potential service disruption, application re-authentication requirements, and extended timeline
mitigation: Early planning for phased user migration, TSA for identity services during transition, automated provisioning tools

trigger: TargetCo operates within shared enterprise platforms requiring data/tenant separation
impact_description: Business disruption, data migration complexity, potential need for new platform implementations, extended timeline
mitigation: Detailed application dependency mapping, TSA agreements, phased migration approach, consider platform replacement vs separation

trigger: TargetCo traffic traverses ParentCo-managed network infrastructure
impact_description: Network segmentation challenges, potential connectivity disruption, firewall rule migration, VPN reconfiguration
mitigation: Network discovery and documentation, parallel network buildout, phased cutover approach

risk: Security tooling and monitoring gaps during transition
trigger: Loss of ParentCo security operations center and centralized security tooling
impact_description: Security monitoring blind spots, incident response capability gaps, compliance violations, potential security incidents
mitigation: Accelerated security tool deployment, TSA for security services, temporary managed security services

risk: Network separation from ParentCo may cause business disruption
trigger: TargetCo currently relies entirely on ParentCo's shared network infrastructure with no independent network architecture
impact_description: Loss of network connectivity could disrupt all business operations including email, applications, internet access, and inter-site communication
mitigation: Establish temporary network connectivity before separation, plan phased cutover approach, and ensure Day 1 connectivity requirements are met

risk: IP address conflicts between TargetCo and BuyerCo networks
trigger: Both organizations likely use common RFC1918 address ranges (10.x.x.x, 192.168.x.x) which could overlap
impact_description: IP conflicts prevent network integration and can block Day 1 connectivity, requiring extensive renumbering efforts
mitigation: Immediate IP address discovery and conflict analysis, plan IP renumbering if needed, consider NAT as temporary solution

risk: Long lead times for new WAN circuits may delay integration
trigger: TargetCo sites will need new connectivity to BuyerCo network, and telecom circuits typically require 30-90 days for installation
impact_description: Delayed circuit installation could push back integration timeline and force extended reliance on temporary connectivity solutions
mitigation: Order circuits immediately upon deal announcement, identify sites requiring new connectivity, consider SD-WAN for faster deployment

risk: Complete dependency on ParentCo security infrastructure and expertise
trigger: Post-acquisition separation from ParentCo systems and loss of ParentCo security team support
impact_description: Loss of security monitoring, incident response capability, and security tooling. Potential security gap during transition period.
mitigation: Develop comprehensive security separation plan with interim managed security services and accelerated security capability buildout

risk: Identity and access management separation complexity
trigger: Migration from ParentCo Azure AD tenant to BuyerCo Azure AD tenant
impact_description: User access disruption, potential security gaps during migration, loss of SSO functionality, and need to reconfigure MFA for all users
mitigation: Detailed IAM migration planning with phased approach, temporary federation, and comprehensive user communication

risk: Security monitoring and SIEM data loss during transition
trigger: Separation from ParentCo Microsoft Sentinel instance
impact_description: Loss of historical security logs, threat intelligence, and security monitoring capability. Potential blind spot for threat detection
mitigation: Implement new SIEM instance before separation, export critical historical data, and establish new log sources and detection rules

trigger: Loss of ParentCo compliance scope coverage and need for independent certifications
impact_description: Potential customer contract violations, regulatory non-compliance, and inability to pursue certain business opportunities
mitigation: Accelerate independent compliance certification process and maintain documentation continuity

risk: Critical path timeline risk due to sequential dependencies across all domains
trigger: Azure AD separation delays cascade to network and security migrations, extending overall timeline beyond 18 months
impact_description: Timeline extends to 24+ months, TSA costs increase by $500K+, business disruption risk increases significantly
cost_impact_estimate: $500K-$1M in additional TSA and delay costs
mitigation: Establish dedicated integration PMO, negotiate extended TSA terms upfront, begin identity separation planning immediately post-close

risk: Cumulative business disruption risk from simultaneous infrastructure changes
trigger: Network, identity, and security changes happening concurrently create compounding user impact
impact_description: Significant productivity loss, potential customer impact, employee satisfaction issues during 6-12 month transition period
cost_impact_estimate: $200K-$500K in productivity loss and change management
mitigation: Implement comprehensive change management program, stagger major changes, establish 24/7 support during transitions
